reviewText: This DVD for beginners is pretty intense to me. I did the first phase: cardio 1 and strength 1. I thought this was pretty good workout, especially someone getting back into low-to-medium intensity, then the next day did cardio 2 and strength 2 which were Bob Harper and boy he wasn't playing when he said you have signed up to phase 2 of the workouts. He is the worst one if you do not want to workout or had the exercise blues, so many uuhs and oohs, but deep breathing for sure. I love Dolvett's persona and workouts as well. I see the challenge at home is just that!I watch "biggest loser" seasons for quite some time, and love when Dolvett joined the crew the last 4 seasons. He has been transforming lives and cannot wait to read his book soon. I read Bob Harper's book this summer and not sure if I want to try it but may try some of the recipes in the near future. He wants to give you a jumpstart to skinny. Okay!The hardest one I did was Power X-train by Biggest Loser workouts thus far. Easiest is Calorie Workout.*Borrowed from library but will have to purchase my own copy soon.Adrienna Turner, author of The Day Begins with Christ.

reviewText: I dont understand how one of the reviews on here said ana ws like a robot.. heck she ws like tht in the biggest loser episodes whn she ws on them she ws the nice one. anyways i have been doing it for 4 days and let me tell ya i got weak cant say i lost any weight but i wnted it to tone not lose weight. I personally love that the ones in the video other than the trainers are not pencil thin models or males with 6 pks. reviewText: I used to be a regular at aerobics classes, and found this great for losing extra weight after giving birth. I was pleasantly surprised by the intensity of the workouts; I actually worked up a sweat while using this video. It was also helpful for getting back into working out after not doing intensive workouts for months, as there are four sections that you can add on gradually (they also have a "maximum results program" on the DVD that helps you out with this, giving you a weekly plan.) My only problem with it is that there's a whole lot of "plank" position in both the cardio and strength training sections, which seems to be a theme throughout the Biggest Loser DVDs, and I have shoulder problems that can get aggravated from holding up all my weight on my arms.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "The Biggest Loser: At Home Challenge" is a four week program for beginners who want to get in shape.  The instructors are Anna Kournikova, Dolvett Quince, and Bob Harper.It is divided into 6 segments, with an instructor leading a group of former contestants, two men and two women, of varying fitness levels.1.Warm-Up (about 5 minutes): Ms. Kournikova leads the group through a slow paced warm-up and stretches.2. Phase One Cardio (about 10 minutes): Ms. Kournikova instructs and the workout is fairly easy.  No weights are used.Jumping jacksSquat, with arms, with heel lift, with jumpSkater, with leg lift, with leapHappy feet, to floor touchRunning man, with knee up, with hopCurtsy kicksPlank, with walking hands, with in and out feet3. Phase One Strength (about 10 1/2 minutes): Mr. Quince instructs and the workout is a little more intense.  No weights are used.Squat to lungePlank, with kneeSquat to lunge, to knee raisePlank with kneeRomanian deadlift, with touchPushup with turnRomanian deadlift, with touch, with leg liftPushup with turnLateral lunge to touchPlank with twisting row4. Phase Two Cardio (about 15 minutes): Mr. Harper instructs this intense workout. One dumbbell is used.Swing, with reach and kneeSquat with ab twistSwing, with reach and kneeSquat with ab twistSquat hold, reachAlternating lunge, with reachJumping jacksBatting practiceSpeed squat, with hopSquat holdBatting practiceSpeed squat, with hopPlie, to side reachSquat hold with reach, to pulse, to jumpPlieJumping jacks and press5. Phase Two Strength (over 13 1/2 minutes): Mr. Harper instructs. Two dumbbells are used.Side to side with twisting rowHold with reachSide to side with twisting rowHold with reachCurtsy lunge, with lateral raise, to hold, to pulseCurtsy lunge, with front raise, to hold, to pulseBack lunge, with curl, to pulse, to holdBack lunge, with curl, to hold, to arm push, to holdSquat to reach and triceps extension, to hold, to pulse6. Cool-Down (about 4 minutes): Ms. Kournikova and the group stretch.I liked Mr. Harper's segments the most.  He was engaging, energetic, and instructive.  Of the exercise segments, phase one cardio was the easiest, and phase two cardio was the most intense and longest.You may customize your workout to play the segments of your choice.  Plus, the video offers a four week plan, which is based on 5 exercise days per week.There is also a bonus 7 minute segment in which the group of four former contestants share stories.  The four are Heba Salama, Jim Germanakos, Rebecca Meyer, and Bernie Salazar.

reviewText: It really gives you a workout and there are alternative movements that you can do. I would suggest this product to anyone!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just started my new lifestyle of getting in shape and being healthier. I haven't worked out in 3 years and I'm fifty pounds overweight. I was only able to do the first cardio challenge, which is the way it works anyway. I thought going in to it, it would be easy and I would do both cardio challenges but I was mistaken! I was barely able to do the first challenge which kind of bothered me because with warm up, cardio and cool down it wasn't the thirty minutes I was aiming for but I shook it off. Getting in shape is going to take some time and the way this dvd works up levels is a great way to start. I recommend it to anyone just starting out and definitely follow their suggestions for the four week challenge.

reviewText: I like the cardio/strength 2 parts of the video because Bob is the trainer. It is a good video to start working out with if this is your first time getting back into working out.

reviewText: I have always tried losing weight in the craziest of ways.  One month i tried the all green diet, the next it was using that crazy 2 month workout called insanity, another was just a fruit diet.  Literally I've tried everything in the books! Suddenly my sister started watching the Biggest Loser, I was hooked! I immediately ordered every possible DVD that the Biggest Loser offered, and started them when i recieved them in the mail.  I can tell you right now, it actually works! Dovett, and Bob's training are amazing! They really help you lose fat and gain muscle! If you want to seriously lose weight the biggest loser allows you to do that! Good luck!
summary: If you want to lose weight, use the biggest loser
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Trish "A Sun Salutin', Crochet Hookin' Chick!"
reviewText: If you've read any of my other Exercise-DVD reviews, you know that I am a huge "Biggest Loser", "The Firm", "Christy Taylor", and "Ana Brett/Ravi Singh" Fan.  I usually give these DVD' 5 stars because I like the structure of the workouts, the instructors enthushiasm, the abilility to customize the workout, the length of the workout, the quality of the workout and/or a combination of these things.There were a some pros and cons (more cons than pros) with the At Home Challenge DVD:Pros:1.  There are different levels (Anna and Dolvette instruct the lower levels and Bob the more intermediate levels) so that everyone is able to complete a daily workout.2.  The home viewer is able to customize a workout according to time limitations and fitness level.3.  I like the Level I Cardio and Strength workouts for beginners.  I like the fact that hand weights are not required to complete them.Cons:1.  It seems like there is too much repetition on certain joints (lots of squats, lunges, planks).  In our certification classes, we are taught that this much repetition overstresses the joint and may cause injury.2.  The sections seem to repeat each other-the cardio sections have planks, lunges, squats and the strength levels have squats, lunges and planks.  Of course the differ, some, but there are plenty of moves where, if you use your imagination, you should be able to have 4 entirely different workouts.3.  The music seems to be there just for sound...none of the instructors works out the to the beat of the music4.  The times on the cover of the DVD are clearly mismarked...if you are planning to complete all 4 levels, it will take closer to an hour than the 40 minutes stated on the cover.5.  The moves in this DVD are similiar to some of the other BL DVD...it's getting a little boring now.6.  In the warm-up section, stretching should be kept to a minimum, until the muscles are warmed up.  There is not enough movement before stretching.I found myself watching the clock and also, moving to other machines in gym during this DVD. Not a good sign.  I found it much to repetitive to be interesting.
summary: Wanted to really like this one...it's okay
Title: N/A
